meanings.definition: A set of written characters representing syllables.
meanings.sent1: In the ancient language, the syllabary was used to write down sounds.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed the students how to read the syllabary in the textbook.
meanings.sent3: The syllabary characters had a party, each one representing a different sound.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a syllabary of memories, each one a unique symbol of her past.
meanings.sent5: The syllabary danced across the page, telling a story with each character.

meanings.definition: A system of writing in which each character represents a syllable.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization used a syllabary to communicate their ideas.
meanings.sent2: Learning the syllabary was essential for understanding the ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The syllabary characters played hide and seek, each one revealing a syllable when found.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a syllabary of emotions, each one a different part of his inner world.
meanings.sent5: The syllabary painted a picture of the past, each character a brushstroke of history.
